name: Thomas MASTROCOLA, Chris & Michelle Hammel, h/w and Michelle McDonald and Wardlaw & Joyce Hall, h/w and John & Peggy Weston, h/w, Petitioners v. SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Mastrocola v. Southeastern Pennsylvania Transportation Authority

parties: Thomas MASTROCOLA, Chris & Michelle Hammel, h/w and Michelle McDonald and Wardlaw & Joyce Hall, h/w and John & Peggy Weston, h/w, Petitioners v. SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 1st day of June, 2009, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is GRANTED limited to the following issues:
1. Is federal preemption based upon choice-of-law preemption a waivable defense?
2. Are Petitioners’ claims in this suit preempted, or are they preserved from preemption by the clarifying amendment to FRSA at 49 U.S.C. § 20106(b)?
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

casebody.head_matter:
973 A.2d 412
Thomas MASTROCOLA, Chris & Michelle Hammel, h/w and Michelle McDonald and Wardlaw & Joyce Hall, h/w and John & Peggy Weston, h/w, Petitioners v. SOUTHEASTERN PENNSYLVANIA TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
June 1, 2009.
